metadata.name: Suspicious Windows Trace ETW Session Tamper Via Logman.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of "logman" utility in order to disable or delete Windows trace sessions

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\logman.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('logman.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('stop ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('delete '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('circular kernel context logger')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('eventlog-')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('sysmon trace')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('sysmondnsetwsession'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of "logman" utility in order to disable or delete Windows trace sessions

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate deactivation by administrative staff 2. Installer tools that disable services, e.g. before log collection agent installation References: https://twitter.com/0gtweet/status/1359039665232306183?s=21, https://ss64.com/nt/logman.html
